headline.main: PREMIER ASKS CALM; Calls on Yugoslavs to Shun Panic and Stand Fast in the Crisis FOREIGNERS FLEE COUNTRY Nazis Are Said to Be Massing Troops on Hungarian Border -- Matchek Accord Reported PREMIER ASKS CALM IN YUGOSLAV CRISIS

lead_paragraph: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, March 31 -- Premier Dusan Simovitch broadcast a stern proclamation to the Yugoslav people tonight demanding that they shun panic, stand fast and "if destiny so orders it, give their lives for the good of their homes, their fatherland and King."
abstract: Premier D Simovitch calls on Yugoslavs to be calm, radio s; says fighting forces are ready to defend Yugoslav independence; foreigners continue to leave country; Germans reptd massing troops on Hungarian-Yugoslav border; Simovitch bid to Vice-Premier V Matchek to join Govt seen as additional proof of Yugoslav determination to resist Axis

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS
